channel.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
channel.description:
I was able to get everything to compile and start properly, but when I try to log in, I receive an error.
I just want to play from my computer.
Everything appears to be set up with 127.0.0.1 and port 43594.
The account created successfully, it just won't log in.
I did check server.java and it does say localhost.
The error I'm receiving is: Sorry! Unable to connect. Check your internet settings or try another world. [code] runclient: [java] Session ID: 1001408763068019695java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out[/code]
I've searched the forums and the web and have came across no solutions. I don't know much about this, so please don't assume much of my technical knowledge.
Thanks

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @Errorist Errorist
item.description:
@Errorist wrote:

I guess my issue is resolved, it’s just giving problems with names that have spaces. Thanks for your help.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Maybe it’s an issue with the id of the account, or it has a problem with the account that is first in your list. Try making another account now, and logging in with that.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @Errorist Errorist
item.description:
@Errorist wrote:

First account: t e s t
Second account: test

I deleted the accounts and tried to start over and now I’m having the same issue as before with it not wanting to log in…

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“Errorist, post:5, topic:520787”]Yes, that is what I’m saying.

And now that the account has been created, I get the same log in error every time I attempt to log in.

EDIT: I just created a 2nd account and it logged in just fine. I do not understand why, but I guess my problem is resolved.[/quote]

Hmmm, what was the name of the first account?

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @Errorist Errorist
item.description:
@Errorist wrote:

Yes, that is what I’m saying.

And now that the account has been created, I get the same log in error every time I attempt to log in.

EDIT: I just created a 2nd account and it logged in just fine. I do not understand why, but I guess my problem is resolved.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“Errorist, post:3, topic:520787”]Thanks for the quick response.

I have verified that every instance of port in all files says 43594. I do not believe that to be my problem. Any other suggestions?[/quote]

Well, here be a little more specific.

Were you saying that when you tried to login to the server the first time, that it created the character for you, but then rejected your login?

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @Errorist Errorist
item.description:
@Errorist wrote:

Thanks for the quick response.

I have verified that every instance of port in all files says 43594. I do not believe that to be my problem. Any other suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v1.1 log in problem
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Check the settings on your client. People set the port to 43595 sometimes, which can be easy to overlook

Read full topic

item.description:

I was able to get everything to compile and start properly, but when I try to log in, I receive an error.

I just want to play from my computer.

Everything appears to be set up with 127.0.0.1 and port 43594.
